Let 
\begin{align}
    \vec{A} = \myvec{11\\16}, \vec{B} = \myvec{23\\21}
\end{align}
Then,
\begin{align}
\vec{B}-\vec{A} = \myvec{12\\5}\;
\end{align}
and
%
\begin{align}
 \norm{\vec{B}-\vec{A}}^2= (\vec{B}-\vec{A})^\top (\vec{B}-\vec{A})\;
&=  \myvec{12 \ 5} \myvec{12\\5}\\
\implies \norm{\vec{B}-\vec{A}}&=\sqrt{(12^2 + 5^2)}\\\nonumber
&=13\\\nonumber
\end{align}
